intro: Lophiolepis bozkirensis, commonly known as the Bozkuş mountain grass, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. Its inflorescence consists of compact spikelets, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
